ygData.subject: Taunt Macro
ygData.msgSnippet: I do not have a warrior, but I do have a bard that I made a track macro for and it should be a similar process.  I think Taunt falls under the category of a
ygData.messageBody:
I do not have a warrior, but I do have a bard that I made a track macro for and it should be a similar process. I think Taunt falls under the category of a doability. Here is a definition from a website I use:

/doability # - Causes player to perform the special ability specified by number. For example, if Lay On Hands if your characters 4th ability (1-6 are the 6 general abilities, while 7-10 are the 4 combat abilities besides Melee and Ranged.), /doability 4 would perform the Lay on Hands.

So, a taunt macro could go like this:

/g Taunting %t onto me
/doability 7(or whatever number it ends up being)


The /g tells your group what you are doing. The /doability # performs the taunt. It should work. Good luck.

BTW, here is a site one of my bard friends Tallies keeps up that has lots of good information:

http://amtgard.pinkpig.com/everquest/eqcommands.htm

Watch out for word wrap when you click the link.

Robiinton Masterhealer
Piemur Draggonsinger

----- Original Message -----

Can that be done with taunt?
